QuestionJSON.Question: Skyler works in a factory building car engines. They are asked to chart the number of defective parts found in their inspections every day for one month. Here are their results: Week 1 = 30, Week 2 = 25, Week 3 = 15, and Week 4 = 10. Which of the following are appropriate ways for Skyler to present this data visually?
QuestionJSON.Answer4: Both the line chart and the bar chart
QuestionJSON.Explanation: Both a bar chart and a line chart can be used to properly visualize the week-by-week changes in defective parts counted. A pie chart wouldn't be helpful in this scenario because it is better suited to compare parts of a whole, while in this situation, it is important to show the change of numbers over time.
